title: The Olympian Gods
description: How well do you know the gods of Olympus?

questions.question: Who is the goddess of wisdom and warfare?
questions.explanation: Athena is the goddess of wisdom, strategic warfare, and crafts. Athens is named after her.

questions.question: What is Poseidon the god of?
questions.explanation: Poseidon is the god of the sea, earthquakes, and horses. He wields a powerful trident.

questions.question: Aphrodite is the goddess of love and beauty.
questions.explanation: Aphrodite is the goddess of love, beauty, and desire, born from the sea foam.

questions.question: Who is the messenger of the gods?
questions.explanation: Hermes is the messenger god, also associated with travelers, thieves, and commerce.

questions.question: Artemis is the goddess of what?
questions.explanation: Artemis is the goddess of the hunt, wilderness, and the moon. She's Apollo's twin sister.

questions.question: Who is Hera?

options.text: Zeus's wife and queen of the gods

questions.explanation: Hera is Zeus's wife and queen of the gods, goddess of marriage and family.

questions.question: Apollo is the god of the sun, music, and poetry.
questions.explanation: Apollo is one of the most important gods, associated with the sun, music, poetry, art, and prophecy.

questions.question: Who is the god of wine and celebration?
questions.explanation: Dionysus is the god of wine, fertility, theater, and religious ecstasy.
